intro: Mollinedia undulata, commonly known as the undulating molly, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a wavy or undulating edge, giving it its common name. Mollinedia undulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
